etymology.description: semantic: 齒(齒) (chǐ, "teeth") + phonetic: 齊 ○ usually written as 齐(齊) from Ancient Scripts = teeth arranged together -> aligned -> together
etymology.interpretation: The character 齊(齊) (qí, "together") originates from the idea of teeth being aligned or arranged in a uniform way. This aligns with the broader sense of the character representing things coming together or being in order.
etymology.simplification: 齐(齊) was chosen as a simplified form due to its simpler strokes, reducing 齊's complexity while keeping a similar upper structure that resembles the original.

examples.chinese: 我们齐心协力(我們齊心協力)，共创美好未来(共創美好未來)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen qíxīn xiélì, gòng chuàng měihǎo wèilái.
examples.english: We work together with one heart to create a bright future.

examples.chinese: 大家齐聚一堂(大家齊聚一堂)，分享欢乐时光(分享歡樂時光)。
examples.pinyin: Dàjiā qí jù yītáng, fēnxiǎng huānlè shíguāng.
examples.english: Everyone gathers together under one roof to share joyful moments.
